If you are in the Abbruzzo region, you must travel to Villa Santa Maria for Ristorante Donna Rachele.

Ristorante Donna Rachele was the most authentic Italian experience during our three week travels through Italy.

The quality of the food and service was of a very high standard. With local Chef Daniele Stanziani and his son Luciano showcasing culinary skills passed down through generations of the local famous chef school which is well known throughout the Abbruzzo region. Utilising the best produce of the Abbruzzo region which included locally sourced meats, cheeses, wines and other liqueurs.

The quality of the service was of a very high standard with the fine dining etiquette shown by the waiters who showcased extensive knowledge of the cuisine provided and the patience to explain to us the background of each local dish and what part of Abbruzzo it was produced (in english).

We travelled 35 hours to arrive in Italy from Australia, and we would happily do it again to visit Ristorante Donna Rachele. We fully recommend this fine dining and authentic Italian culinary experience.

The Stanziani family is well known on the culinary scene and also have restaurants in Venice.

***

For those still reading - this is a very brief backstory.

Villa Santa Maria is where my family are from (my dad and my nonna's village).

We were staying with family in the Abbruzzo region however it was looking like we were unable to come to the village - because we reached out to the beautiful community in Abbruzzo for the bus timetable who informed us there were no busses on Sundays.

We subsequently received a response from a well known resident who very kindly offered to pick us up from our location (1.5 hours away) and take us on a full day tour of the city and the region - we were completely overwhelmed by his kindness and local knowledge.

We spent the whole day together (we are family now) and he recommended this restaurant as we were seeking an authentic experience and locally sourced ingredients.

He also took us to the trabucco along the coastline of Pescara area (Abbruzzo is famous for this). These were formally fishing huts, now restaurants.

We have spent a bit of time here to see family and the region is so beautiful - our favourite part of our trip.

Hope this post helps many to take the trains in Italy as see a lot of people feel unsure etc about them. Here is a picture I took of the departure board at Roma Termini.

You will see a lot ofआणखी info, the most important:
Second column = Train number (Very important!)
Fourth column = Departure time from the station
Last column = Platform number

Simple as that. When you book a train it will have a number. Use that to find your train on the board. 10-15 min ahead of arrival at your station it will tell you what platform to be on.

HOW TO BUY...
At station in person

Via apps (Trenitalia and italo are the main operators and have own apps, personally used trainline to buy as charged me in £ so no foreign fees etc - i'm from UK)

REMEMBER...
If you buy ticket in person, validate it before getting on train. Machines are in ticket halls. Cannot miss them.

If you buy online no need to validate.
